blog.name: superioroctopus
blog.title: 🐙 ‘Sup Spider-Man! 🕷
blog.description: Blog dedicated to Dr. Otto Octavius, primarily his Superior Spider-Man and Superior Octopus personas.

summary: After much delay I finally got around to reading Spider Geddon. Which means I could finally get caught up with Superior Spider...
body:
After much delay I finally got around to reading Spider Geddon. Which means I could finally get caught up with Superior Spider Man.

I was a little bit curious as to why Otto would take up the Spider-Man name again, but this new series picks up right where Superior Octopus left off, and I’m very much looking forward to seeing Anna Maria rip Otto a new one every month.

From Superior Spider-Man #3

summary: I just watched Into the Spider-Verse again, and I can’t believe I forgot how incredibly extra Doc Ock is in her first fight...
body:
I just watched Into the Spider-Verse again, and I can’t believe I forgot how incredibly extra Doc Ock is in her first fight scene. An incomplete list:

  • Pausing to monologue whenever she gets a good hit in
  • Posing like a lunging predator when she hurls herself at Miles in spite of the fact that none of her flesh-and-blood limbs are in any way involved
  • Rampaging through the forest knocking over trees that are nowhere near her flight path, apparently just on general principle
  • When Miles takes shelter behind a large tree, rather than flipping around it or swatting it aside – both of which she’s demonstrably capable of doing – she takes the time to carefully bisect it lengthwise and dramatically gesture with the resulting halves

It stands out all the more when literally every other villain in the film is a manfully scowling hardass, and then there’s Olivia just pinballing around the scenery with that shrieking manic energy – like, did she not get the memo that this is a Serious Villainous Organisation For Serious People?

I love it.

It stands out all the more when literally every other villain in the film is a manfully scowling hardass, and then there’s Olivia just pinballing around the scenery with that shrieking manic energy – like, did she not get the memo that this is a Serious Villainous Organisation For Serious People?

trail.content:
I just watched Into the Spider-Verse again, and I can’t believe I forgot how incredibly extra Doc Ock is in her first fight scene. An incomplete list:

  • Pausing to monologue whenever she gets a good hit in
  • Posing like a lunging predator when she hurls herself at Miles in spite of the fact that none of her flesh-and-blood limbs are in any way involved
  • Rampaging through the forest knocking over trees that are nowhere near her flight path, apparently just on general principle
  • When Miles takes shelter behind a large tree, rather than flipping around it or swatting it aside – both of which she’s demonstrably capable of doing – she takes the time to carefully bisect it lengthwise and dramatically gesture with the resulting halves

It stands out all the more when literally every other villain in the film is a manfully scowling hardass, and then there’s Olivia just pinballing around the scenery with that shrieking manic energy – like, did she not get the memo that this is a Serious Villainous Organisation For Serious People?

I love it.

tags: well... a fan can dream right???
summary: Spider man Far From Home theories
body:
Spider man Far From Home theories

#a little bit spoiler for Captain Marvel# (maybe?)

So…. when Fury was chased by the Shield agents in the archive room, I can’t helped but noticed that one of them was called “Jones”.

(Hey Jones, over here!)

Now… if Michelle’s surname was really Jones, what if that agent was her father?

Captain Marvel was set around 90’s. In 2016, MJ and friends were 15, made them were born in 2001 or 2002. It will made MJ knew Nick Fury, whether the acquaitance in a good term or in a bad term.

(At first I was thinking: what if Monica was MJ’s mom. But… I think she will be too young.)

Now, I was imagining a moment in Far from home.

What if it goes like this:

After the chaos has ended, the enemy has been defeated, the mace has been swinged to smashed something, MJ approaced an injured Peter and inspecting the injuries. Then Nick Fury came from behind them

Fury: great job, Mr. Parker.

Peter: ah… I… eh, thanks, I gues… uuh… MJ this… she’s… (blabering and stutering in his try to explain who Nick Fury was)

MJ: *nods in aknowledgment* uncle Nick…

Fury: my…. you really have grown…. how’s (enter MJ’s mom name)

MJ: *glaring* Fine. No thanks to you.

Peter: what just happened? (With confused face again)

:)

Eeeehh…. just a random thougts. XD
